data.title: Convention and activity hub
data.text: The convention center provides a unique social event venue on the Mobile Waterfront and is a great spot for a convention or exposition.

data.title: A rather new convention centre with a good range of facilities
data.text: Beautiful building next to the water. Very airy and easy to get to. Walkway from the hotel next to it.

data.title: Conference
data.text: The facility is designed to handle a large crowd with experienced staff. The parking is not all that great unless you are staying on site where the facilities are very good.

data.title: Good meeting place
data.text: We were here for five days of meetings.  The place was very clean and well run.  There wouldn't be anything to see if you didn't have a meeting there, but if you were considering it for a future meeting I thing you would be pleased.

data.title: Very nice COLD facility
data.text: This was a nice place for a convention, but it was like a meat locker.  Freezing.  The food was reasonable, the people were great.  Overall, very nice, especially if you had thought to bring your jacket and mittens in June to Alabama.

data.title: Convention PCA
data.text:
Beautiful location, great parking, beautiful views, great photo ops. 

Friendly staff, and easy to work with. We were their as exhibitors at this event. 

Clean and presented well.

data.title: Decent but not spectacular
data.text: Seems like a good facility, with a lot of large areas for meetings and festivals and conventions, but the directions and parking can be very confusing. Restrooms are very outdated and unclean. Staff and service seems ok but not great.

data.title: Great experience!
data.text:
I worked in the center for two, consecutive days and found the staff to be very accommodating and friendly.  The room was very nice and set-up perfectly for the event...quick turn-around, too. I took a tour of the new, updated restrooms, and they will be first-class.  

I would definitely recommend the convention center to other professional groups.

data.title: Nice convention center but a bit confusing
data.text:
After I got to know the lay out I liked this convention center. The architecture is quite nice but as someone else commented all the stairs can be a problem. There are many front entrances and ways to get up to the main entrance, mostly stairs but there are elevators. Problem is they are not marked or easily visible.

While we were there they were renovating the bathrooms which seemed to be a problem but overall it was nice and clean and we didnt run into any issues. It is right on the bay and gives good view to the industry that is on the bay. It is right across the street from the parking garage, the Renaissance and Battle House Hotels (both very nice) and is connected with a covered bridge.

It is near much of the downtown area so there are alot of little specialty shops and cafe's within walking distance or by car you can go a short distance to places like the USS Alabama Battle Ship.

Overall and with a little knowledge of the convention center itself and the surrounding area I enjoyed this place.

data.title: It's 2014 and the restrooms are still deploreable.
data.text: I know this can't be fixed but the main entrance is a huge problem. There are so many stairs, and if you are at a professional conference like I was, it makes it hard to walk in professional footwear. The water fountains in the main exhibit hall were also non-functioning, which is really annoying. The restrooms were constantly a mess , there was either no water or very low water pressure, the doors did not lock, and I only saw cleaning staff once during my 3 days here.

data.title: Good venue for a professional conference
data.text: I was just here for two days of a five-day conference for the Southern Historical Assn.  The venue seemed ideal for a conference:  plenty of smaller rooms for panel presentations and larger rooms for book exhibits.  Also, it was conveniently linked to the Plaza Riverview hotel.  I had no problems with the restrooms like the other reviewer; however, the walls between the rooms for presentations were far from soundproof.  Other than that--no problems at all.

data.title: BRING YOUR OWN TOILET IF YOU WILL BE IN THE MAIN AREA DOWNSTAIRS!!
data.text: I spoke with the general manager about the horrible conditions, very much outdated and unsafe of the restrooms.  Ladies get locked in and you have to kick the wall to close the door while trying to use the restrooms.  Was told in a year they will make improvements.  They could start off with a five dollar or less lock for number 3 stall on the left hand side of the ladies restroom on the right side of the outside doors near the water.  Blind ladies getting locked in, people recovering from strokes having a horrible time.  Toilets don't flush.  Very young cleaning lady that didn't clean.  One wonderful, hospitable lady there helped me when the toilet would not flush.  Frances.  She helped us when the sink was flooding.  Very helpful, caring lady.  The place is beautiful on the outside and I like the walk in the back like you are on a cruise ship but it is very much lacking in things to do and working updated 2012 restrooms for disabled and well bodied humans.  Paying customers should be taken care of for safety and hygenic reasons.  Was cleaned after alot of us spoke up.  General manager saying in a year there will be an improvement was unsatifactory for us ladies who are suffering.  We need more toilets that work and more of them.  Nicer to fit the outside look of the building.  The building itself is nice if you don't have to use the restroom.
